items.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 08 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-66945-9 This study provides evidence of a cascading positive tipping point towards electric vehicles, which has occurred or lies within the next few years in lead markets of the EU and China, and potentially the US, and it could spill out into peripheral vehicle marketss across the rest of the world.

items.title: Flash droughts exacerbate global vegetation loss and delay recovery
authors: Yuanfang Chai
Chiyuan Miao

Jiachen Ji

Josep Pe√±uelas
items.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 08 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-67173-x Climate change is increasing the frequency of flash droughts worldwide, posing threats to global ecosystems. This study suggests that flash droughts cause 1.5 times greater vegetation loss than conventional droughts and delay ecosystem recovery, with impacts intensifying over recent decades.

authors: Guorong Xiao
Mengjiao Yang
Duanyang Kong
items.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 07 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-67390-4 Accessing tricyclic frameworks with multiple contiguous stereocenters remains challenging. Here, the authors report a isothiourea/Ir-catalyzed [3 + 2] annulation providing trans-fused tricyclic Œ≥-lactams with three contiguous tertiary stereocenters.

items.title: CASSIA: a multi-agent large language model for automated and interpretable cell annotation
authors: Elliot Xie

Jihua Liu
Chitrasen Mohanty
Mahua Dey
Christina Kendziorski
items.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 07 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-67084-x Assigning cell types in single-cell RNA-seq is essential yet challenging, as it requires expertise, time, and is often subjective. Here, the authors present CASSIA, a multi-agent AI system that provides automated, interpretable, and quality-controlled annotations with high accuracy.

items.title: Molecular competition induced Janus hydrogel bioelectronic interface for electroceutical modulation

Zhenhua Ni
Xiaochen Dong
items.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 07 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-67143-3 Janus hydrogel bioelectronic interfaces are challenged by complex fabrication, poor tunability of asymmetric properties and weak interlayer bonding strength. Here, the authors create a Janus hydrogel with dual structural and compositional gradients in one step via molecular competition induction mechanism.

items.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 07 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-67171-z Loss-of-function mutations in EP300/KAT3B and CBP/KAT3A have been implicated in the pathogenesis of cancer. Here, the authors reveal that the EP300 protein has a role in mediating replication fork protection at sites of replication stalling and show that EP300-mutated cells recapitulate features of BRCA-deficient cancers.
